CedGooglePlusComments is a powerful content plugin that allows for easy integration of Google+ comment system.
### Google+ Google+ Comments look similar to traditional Facebook comments, but have some important differences. For example: When you leave a comment on a blog, you'll see the option, checked by default, to also share that comment to Google+.. Google+ posts that link to blog posts will show up as a comment underneath those blog posts. If original comment is shared to Google+, replies to the comment on the blog will show up in Google+ and vice versa, but only to the people that the original comment was shared with. If a comment is not shared with the blog author, the blog author will not be able to see the comment in either location. As the author of a post, you’ll receive Google+ notifications when readers comment on or share your blog post. What if my readers don’t have a Google+ profile or page? Can they still comment? No, but they will be prompted to create one when they attempt to comment.
Google+ Comments is not available for private blogs and for blogs with adult content.
What happens when I remove a comment? Removing a Google+ comment will only affect the comment in the particular location you removed it from. For example, someone might create a public Google+ post that links to your blog post -- and since it links to your blog post, it'll show up as a comment on your blog. You can remove the instance of this post from your blog, but your removal won't affect the original post from showing up on Google+.
### Features ✓ Width of the comments box ✓ Display social interactions made on Google Plus. ✓ Themes light or dark ✓ Comments moderation support. (If you provide a Google+ Profile ID) ✓ Should a comments counter be displayed in all views except the article view. ✓ Enable comment icon if count is shown.
